Title: Establishes a legal services veterans tax credit for attorneys who perform certain services for veterans and disabled veterans
Summary: Establishes a legal services veterans tax credit of up to $1,500 for any attorney who performs a minimum of fifty hours of pro bono legal services to a veteran or disabled veteran during a taxable year; provides that such services shall include, but not be limited to, veteran's benefits and appeals, military discharges and upgrades, public benefits, evictions and foreclosures, and consumer debt issues.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to establishing a legal services veterans tax credit for attorneys who perform certain civil cases and services for veterans and disabled veterans
